intro: Lastrea pabstii, commonly known as the Pabst's lastrea, is a species of flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun conditions. Its flowers are usually yellow or orange, with a distinctive shape that resembles a dandelion. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
